qas.question: What noble family wielded power during the Heian period?
Who threatened the authority of Japan's central government?
Masakado led an uprising in what province?
What member of the Fujiwara family rebelled in western Japan?
In what year did Masakado begin his rebellion?
Who ruled the Fujiwara family in Japan?

plausible_answers.text: the Fujiwara and other noble families

qas.question: Who needed guards and soldiers to protect their interests in the imperial court?
Who's political power declined during the Heian period?
Who threatened the central governments authourity during the 9th century A.D.?
What did Fujiwara no Sumitoma lead in the east?

context: Nominally, sovereignty lay in <b5_0>the emperor<b5_0/> but in fact power was wielded by the <a0_0>Fujiwara<a0_0/> nobility. However, to protect their interests in the provinces, <b6_0>the Fujiwara and other noble families<b6_0/> required guards, police and soldiers. <b7_0>The warrior class<b7_0/> made steady political gains throughout the Heian period. As early as <a4_0>939 A.D<a4_0/>, <a1_0><b8_0>Taira no Masakado<b8_0/><a1_0/> threatened the authority of the central government, leading <b9_0>an uprising<b9_0/> in the eastern province of <a2_0>Hitachi<a2_0/>, and almost simultaneously, <a3_0>Fujiwara no Sumitomo<a3_0/> rebelled in the west. Still, a true military takeover of the Japanese government was centuries away, when much of the strength of the government would lie within the private armies of the shogunate.
